hero.title: Who's to blame for the wasted 6 million election ballots for 2025?
hero.description: At least P13 million worth of paper will be shredded, following a Supreme Court order that effectively compelled the Comelec to revise its ballot design after printing had already begun. Whose fault is it?

primary.title: PH to be placed under food security emergency
primary.description: In a bid to bring down the price of rice, the country is likely to be placed under a food security emergency by next week.

secondary.title: Explainer: What is a food security emergency?
secondary.description: Under Republic Act 12078 or the law amending the Agricultural Tariffication Act, the Agriculture Secretary has the power to declare a food security emergency on rice due to a supply shortage or extraordinary increase in prices.

secondary.title: As rice prices stay high ‘Food Security Emergency’ to be declared to bring down prices
secondary.description: The Department of Agriculture said it was set to declare a food security emergency as rice prices stayed high despite tariff cuts and lower prices in the world market.

secondary.title: <abbr title="President Bongbong Marcos">PBBM</abbr> backs food security emergency declaration
secondary.description: President Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr. on Friday expressed support for the declaration of food security emergency to bring down the prices of rice.

carousel.title: The Making of Edgar Matobato - PCIJ.org
carousel.description: It is a wonder Edgar Matobato is still alive. A confessed assassin for the Davao Death Squad, he was the first to go public about the killings allegedly ordered by former President Rodrigo Duterte.

carousel.title: PNP summons mall guard over viral video mistreating young vendor
carousel.description: Manila, Philippines — The Philippine National Police - Supervisory Office for Security and Investigation Agencies (PNP-Sosia) has summoned the mall security guard accused of mistreating a young girl wearing a school uniform

carousel.title: Hunger rate at its highest since pandemic — SWS
carousel.description: The number of Filipino households experiencing involuntary hunger has jumped to 25.9%, the highest since the COVID-19 pandemic.

carousel.title: DFA working on repatriation of slain Filipina's remains from Slovenia
carousel.description: The Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) said on Thursday, Jan. 16, that it is working together with the Philippine Embassy in Vienna to repatriate the remains of Marvil Facturan Kocjančič, a Filipina who was allegedly stabbed to death by her Slovenian husband.
